sentences.en: His cartoon mercilessly lampoon the leading politician of the day.
sentences.cn: 他的讽刺漫画无情地挖苦了当今的政界要人.

sentences.en: His cartoons mercilessly lampoon the leading politician of the day.
sentences.cn: 他的漫画无情地讽刺了当今的政界要人.

sentences.en: Such gaffes and inexperience made Mr Kaczynski easy to lampoon.
sentences.cn: 上述种种失态与缺乏经验,让卡钦斯基先生轻易成为讽刺的对象.

sentences.en: The Prime Minister was frequently lampooned in political cartoons.
sentences.cn: 首相在政治漫画里频遭嘲讽。

sentences.en: The style Shelley is using here is that of popular lampoon.
sentences.cn: 这里雪莱用的是通俗的嘲讽手法。

sentences.en: To ridicule or satirize in or as if in a lampoon.
sentences.cn: 嘲讽用讽刺作品或好象用讽刺作品嘲弄或讽刺.

sentences.en: Visit Wat Phra Thad Haripoonchai, one of the most magnificent and oldest temple in Lampoon.
sentences.cn: 参观帕辛寺,是清迈兰普最大最华丽的佛寺.

trans.tran_en: A lampoon is a piece of writing or speech which criticizes someone or something very strongly, using humorous means
to criticize someone or something in a humorous way that makes them seem stupid
